tit.e: Geishogi Kaiho Rei (the Prostitute Emancipation Edict)
Geishogi Kaiho Rei (Emancipation Edict for Female Performers and Prostitutes)
tit.cmt: 娼婦だけでなく、芸＋娼なので、Emancipation Edict for Female Performers and Prostitutes としました。定訳は不明ですが英語の論文でそう書いている人がいるようなので参考にしました。http://www.princeton.edu/~collcutt/doc/Botsman_English.pdf
tit.e: Geishogi Kaiho Rei (Emancipation Edict for Female Performers and Prostitutes)

sen.j: 芸娼妓解放令（げいしょうぎかいほうれい）とは、明治政府が1872年に発した遊女の人身売買の規制などを目的とした法令。
sen.e: The Geishogi Kaiho Rei is a law issued by the Meiji Government in 1872, whose main aim was to control human traffic of prostitutes.
The Geishogi Kaiho Rei is a law issued by the Meiji Government in 1872, whose main aim was to control human traffic of prostitutes.

sen.j: 1872年(明治5年)、マリアルス号事件（マリア・ルーズ号事件）が発生。
sen.e: In 1872 the María Luz Incident occurred.
In 1872 the María Luz Incident occurred.
In 1872 the María Luz Incident occurred.

sen.j: 人権問題の解消を促す流れの中で、芸娼妓解放令が出された。
sen.e: The Geishogi Kaiho Rei was announced in the process of settling the incident which involved a human rights issue.
sen.cmt: 原文「人権問題の解消」の意味があいまい。Wikipediaマリアルス号事件の項を参照し、「マリアルス号事件の人権問題の解消」として訳出。
sen.e: The Geishogi Kaiho Rei was announced in the process of settling the incident which involved a human rights issue.
The Geishogi Kaiho Rei was announced in the process of settling the incident which involved a human rights issue.

sen.j: 強制的な年季奉公の廃止など、公娼制度を大規模に制限する法令であった。
sen.e: The law provided major restrictions to government-approved prostitution by abolishing forced apprenticeship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 公娼制度 定訳不明
sen.e: The law provided major restrictions to government-approved prostitution by abolishing forced apprenticeship.
The law provided major restrictions to government-approved prostitution by abolishing forced apprenticeship.

sen.j: しかし準備期間が全くないまま唐突に発せられた点は否めず、解放された女性の転職、収入面の補償などのケアは個々の地方に任される状態であった。
sen.e: However, since it was announced abruptly with no preparation period, the Meiji Government had to have local governments deal with aftercare services for liberated prostitutes such as finding new jobs and compensating for their lost income.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, since it was announced abruptly with no preparation period, the Meiji Government had to have local governments deal with aftercare services for liberated women in pleasant quarters, particularly prostitutes, such as finding new jobs and compensating for their lost income.
sen.cmt: 解放された女性 liberated prostitutesでは、娼婦限定になってしまいますが、娼婦とも芸妓ともつかない層があったと考えられることから、liberated women in pleasant quarters, particularly prostitutes としました。
sen.e: However, since it was announced abruptly with no preparation period, the Meiji Government had to have local governments deal with aftercare services for liberated women in pleasant quarters, particularly prostitutes, such as finding new jobs and compensating for their lost income.

sen.j: このため、法令としてはあまり機能せず、女性がおかれた状態はあまり変わらなかったという。
sen.e: Such being the case, the Geishogi Kaiho Rei didn't really function as a law; thus it didn't make a big difference in prostitutes' condition.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味があいまい。「女性」が「当時の女性一般」なのか「遊女」なのか不明・訳では「遊女」とした。
sen.e: Such being the case, the Geishogi Kaiho Rei didn't really function as a law; thus it didn't make a big difference in the condition of those women.
sen.cmt: 上と同じで、娼婦限定ではないので、上で説明したことを受け、those womenとしました。
sen.e: Such being the case, the Geishogi Kaiho Rei didn't really function as a law; thus it didn't make a big difference in the condition of those women.

sen.j: 芸娼妓解放令は直接的に機能したとは言い難い状態であったが、同令がきっかけとなり、貧農の娘の身売りを防ぐために、女性に対して教育や軽工業に対応する技能習得の場が設けられた地方もある。
sen.e: The Geishogi Kaiho Rei wasn't very effective in changing the situation directly; however, as its by-product, in some regions, opportunities for women to study and to achieve vocational skills for light industry were created with the intent of preventing poor peasants from selling their daughters into prostitution.
sen.cmt: 原文の「直接的に機能した」の意味がわかりにくい。教育・技術習得の場は「女紅場」のことをさしていると思われる。Wikipediaの女紅場の記述を参考に訳出
sen.e: The Geishogi Kaiho Rei wasn't very effective in changing the situation directly; however, as its by-product, in some regions, opportunities for women to study and to achieve vocational skills for light industry were created with the intent of preventing poor peasants from selling their daughters into prostitution.

sen.j: これらの中には、明治時代中期以降に女性労働力に着目したマニュファクチュアの基盤を形成したものも多い。
sen.e: After the middle of Meiji Period, many of these women's educational and vocational institutions formed the basis of manufacture, where female labor was recognized and utilized.
sen.cmt: 原文の「これら」は前文の教育・技能習得の場をさすと思われるが、文の意図するところがあいまい。
